verses.roman:
upaniṣad-śabde yei mukhya artha haya
sei artha mukhya,--vyāsa-sūtre saba kaya

synonyms: upaniṣad—of the Vedas; śabde—by the words; yei—whatever; mukhya—direct; artha—meaning; haya—is; sei—that; artha—meaning; mukhya—chief; vyāsa-sūtre—in the Vedānta-sūtra; saba—all; kaya—describes.
translation: Caitanya Mahāprabhu continued, "The Vedānta-sūtra is the summary of all the Upaniṣads; therefore whatever direct meaning is there in the Upaniṣads is also recorded in the Vedānta-sūtra, or Vyāsa-sūtra.

purport.content: Śrīla Bhaktisiddhānta Sarasvatī has explained the word upaniṣad in his Anubhāṣya. Please refer to Ādi-līlā, Second Chapter, fifth verse, and Ādi-līlā, Seventh Chapter, verses 106 and 108, for his explanation.
